snippet: Sudan and the breakaway nation of South Sudan have been locked in a dangerous game of brinkmanship over billions of gallons of oil.
abstract: Sudan and the breakaway nation of South Sudan are locked in an exceedingly dangerous game of brinksmanship over billions of gallons of oil, seizing tankers, shutting down wells and imperiling their tenuous, American-backed peace that held, if barely, after decades of war; conflict is largely waged through proxy rebel groups along the countries' disputed frontier, and few analysts see any ready solutions to the dispute.
lead_paragraph: Sudan and the breakaway nation of South Sudan have been locked in a dangerous game of brinkmanship over billions of gallons of oil.

headline.main: Sudans’ Oil Feud Risks Shattering a Fragile Peace
headline.print_headline: Sudans’ Oil Feud Risks Shattering a Fragile Peace
